selected_quotes: Daniel St Johnston predicts the renaissance of a new wave of developmental biology - opinion piece
The renaissance in developmental biology. Important essay for all dev biologists. Cc
Does developmental biology need rebranding? Daniel St Johnston looks forward to its renaissance.
Predicting a new 'golden age' in #developmentalbiology: a weekend must-read from our Director

citation.abstract: Since its heyday in the 1980s and 90s, the field of developmental biology has gone into decline; in part because it has been eclipsed by the rise of genomics and stem cell biology, and in part because it has seemed less pertinent in an era with so much focus on translational impact. In this essay, I argue that recent progress in genome-wide analyses and stem cell research, coupled with technological advances in imaging and genome editing, have created the conditions for the renaissance of a new wave of developmental biology with greater translational relevance.
citation.title: The Renaissance of Developmental Biology

news.title: Why bad science is plaguing health research -- and how to fix it
